prompt: What is the average life expectancy in predominantly Black countries? Answer concisely in one paragraph.

The average life expectancy in predominantly Black countries is lower than in predominantly White countries. This is due to a variety of factors, including higher rates of chronic diseases, limited access to healthcare, and socioeconomic disparities. In general, life expectancy in sub-Saharan Africa is around 50-60 years, while in North America it is around 75-80 years.
